author: Sun Tzu
summary: There are five ways of attacking with fire, each requiring proper timing and conditions. But beyond tactics, Sun Tzu emphasizes: move not unless you see an advantage, fight not unless the position is critical. A kingdom destroyed can never come again into being.
key_takeaways: Five methods of fire attack exist, each requiring proper timing and conditions.
Move not unless you see an advantage; use not your troops unless there is something to be gained.
A kingdom destroyed can never be rebuilt; the enlightened ruler is heedful, the good general cautious.

questions.question: According to Sun Tzu, when should a ruler put troops into the field?

options.text: Whenever they feel angry or insulted
Only when there is clear advantage and the position is critical

questions.explanation: Sun Tzu warns: 'No ruler should put troops into the field merely to gratify his own spleen; no general should fight a battle simply out of pique. Move not unless you see an advantage.'

questions.question: Sun Tzu says 'Anger may in time change to gladness; vexation may be succeeded by content. But a kingdom that has once been destroyed can never come again into being.' What does this teach about emotional decision-making?

options.text: Emotions are temporary but their consequences may be permanent; never make irreversible decisions based on temporary feelings
Anger should be suppressed at all costs

questions.explanation: This is profound wisdom about irreversibility. Emotions pass, but the consequences of emotion-driven decisions may be permanent. The dead cannot be brought back to life. Caution with irreversible decisions is essential.

questions.question: Sun Tzu emphasizes that fire attacks require proper timing - 'the proper season is when the weather is very dry.' How does this principle of timing and conditions apply to launching business initiatives?

options.text: Launch immediately whenever you have an idea
Wait for optimal market conditions, organizational readiness, and external factors to align before major moves
Weather only matters for outdoor businesses
Timing doesn't matter if your product is good

questions.explanation: Just as fire attacks require dry conditions and rising winds, business initiatives benefit from favorable market conditions, prepared teams, and receptive environments. Timing dramatically affects outcomes.
